articles.title: NASA just launched a new podcast to Mars
articles.description: The eight-episode series will follow a spacecraft to the Red Planet. NASA’s first trip to Mars may be a few years off, but that didn’t stop the space agency from embarking on a new mission to the Red Planet in podcast form. Read Full Story

articles.title: Anker's portable projector, the Nebula Mars II, is down to $400

articles.author: Eric Mack
articles.title: How a trip to Mars could be just a series of long naps - CNET
articles.description: Human hibernation is possible and in limited use today, and one company with NASA's backing is working to make it part of future interplanetary travel plans.
articles.content: If humans begin to travel to Mars in the next few decades, the one-way travel time of several months is going to make a long-haul international flight on Earth seem like a joyride. Fortunately, one company is working to make it much easier to not just fall as… [+6223 chars]

articles.author: Buzz60, Buzz60, Buzz60
articles.title: Scientists are fighting over the landing spot for the Mars 2020 rover
articles.description: We know that NASA’s Mars 2020 rover is heading to Mars in July of 2020, what we don’t know is where it will land.

articles.title: Bruno Mars Celebrated His Birthday By ‘Hiring’ Ed Sheeran
articles.description: Mars gave himself a 24K Magic birthday gift.
articles.content: When Sheeran finished his reworked rendition, Mars playfully ordered him to do it “again.” Sheeran, who in August hinted at an upcoming musical project with Mars, obliged. “You know you’ve made it when you can hire Ed Sheeran to sing you Happy Birthday,” Mars… [+97 chars]

articles.author: KENNETH CHANG
articles.title: Lights, Camera, Blastoff: Rockets Light Up Southern California’s Night Skies
articles.description: As SpaceX and other companies use the Vandenberg Air Force Base launch hub near Los Angeles more often, the region can expect more spectacles like the one visible on Sunday.
articles.content: There have been 11 launches so far this year from Vandenberg, five of them by SpaceX. Over the decades, the number of launches has actually been declining, from more than 900 in the 1960s to just 79 so far this decade. But the pace has picked up the last coup… [+907 chars]

articles.author: Mike Wall Space.com Senior Writer
articles.title: Opportunity Rover still silent on Mars, 4 months after epic dust storm
articles.description: The Opportunity rover's silent stretch on Mars has now reached four months.
articles.content: The Opportunity rover's silent stretch on Mars has now reached four months. Opportunity hasn't made a peep since June 10. Around that time, a developing dust storm shrouded its environs in darkness, preventing the solar-powered rover from harvesting enough su… [+2319 chars]

articles.title: Aliens could be hiding on Mars living in briny water under planet’s surface, new study says
articles.description: Sponge-like creatures could be lurking beneath the surface of Mars, according to new research.
